title: [CORE-101] Environment and API configuration hardening
body:
As a developer, I want centralized environment and API config so modules run in mock and real modes.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Environment contracts are typed and validated.
2. API base URL and mock switch are centralized.
3. API endpoint constants are consumed by services.

title: [CORE-102] In-repo planning standards and DoD
body:
As a team, we need consistent backlog/DoD docs so sprint execution stays aligned.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Planning templates are available in docs.
2. DoD checklist is standardized.
3. Engineering and QA use common issue format.

title: [AUTH-001] Secure login and session lifecycle
body:
As a user, I want secure login/session continuity so access is reliable.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Valid login creates session and role-based redirect.
2. Invalid login shows actionable error.
3. Session restore works on reload.
4. Expired token triggers refresh or login redirect.

title: [AUTH-002] Permission-based route and action control
body:
As an admin, I want permission-governed routes/actions so sensitive operations are protected.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Unauthorized route access is blocked.
2. Write actions hidden for read-only users.
3. Permission overrides apply immediately.

title: [DASH-001] Role-specific dashboard widgets from backend
body:
As a role-based user, I want contextual KPIs so I can act quickly.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Owner/tenant/societyAdmin/vendor dashboards differ correctly.
2. Month/year filter applies across cards.
3. KPI drill-down routes are available.

title: [PROP-001] Property and unit CRUD with validation
body:
As an owner/admin, I want property and unit lifecycle management so records remain accurate.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Property and unit create/update validations enforced.
2. Search/filter is deterministic.
3. Updated records reflect immediately.

title: [PROP-002] Occupancy history and check-in/check-out sync
body:
As operations, I want occupancy transitions tracked so tenancy timeline is auditable.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Check-in/out creates historical records.
2. Current occupancy reflects latest state.
3. Tenants/payments/dashboard refresh events are triggered.

title: [TEN-001] Tenant directory and profile with role scoping
body:
As owner/admin, I want tenant list and profile so tenancy health can be managed.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Filters by property/status/search.
2. Profile shows tenancy and payment context.
3. Visibility is role-scoped.

title: [PAY-001] Payment lifecycle management
body:
As owner/admin, I want payment lifecycle controls for reliable collections.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Create/edit/status transitions work.
2. Due/paid aggregates are accurate.
3. Tenant sees only own records.

title: [PAY-002] Late fee and defaulter intelligence
body:
As finance/admin, I want automated late fee/defaulter status for timely follow-ups.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Late fee policy configurable.
2. Defaulter flags update by rules.
3. Dashboard/report stays in sync.

title: [SOC-001] Buildings and flats hierarchy
body:
As society admin, I want building-floor-flat hierarchy so operations map correctly.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Hierarchy CRUD works.
2. Owner/tenant mapping supported.
3. Flat occupancy visible.

title: [SOC-002] Maintenance cycle and defaulter tracking
body:
As society admin, I want maintenance billing cycles and defaulter visibility.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Monthly cycle generation works.
2. Interest/late fees apply by policy.
3. Defaulter export available.

title: [SOC-003] Complaints to work-order SLA workflow
body:
As resident/admin/vendor, I want complaint-to-resolution tracking with SLA.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Complaint raise and assignment works.
2. SLA timer and breach states are visible.
3. Resolution timeline is auditable.

title: [SOC-004] Meetings and notices governance flow
body:
As society admin, I want meetings and notices workflow for transparent governance.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Meeting schedule/agenda/attendance supported.
2. Minutes upload linked to meeting.
3. Notices can be targeted and published.

title: [SOC-005] Visitors and parking operations
body:
As security/admin, I want visitor and parking digital workflows.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Pre-approval and entry/exit logs available.
2. Slot assignment/release works.
3. Daily occupancy summary available.

title: [MKT-001] Marketplace listing and inquiry lifecycle
body:
As owner/public user, I want listing and inquiry workflows for better conversion.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Listing CRUD and filters work.
2. Inquiry capture and tracking works.
3. Owner can monitor inquiry status.

title: [REP-001] Unified reports and export integrity
body:
As admin/finance, I want filter-consistent reports and exports.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Reports come from backend aggregates.
2. Filters apply consistently.
3. Export output matches UI.

title: [SET-001] User settings and tenant preferences
body:
As user/admin, I want profile and preferences management for tenant-ready operations.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Profile/locale/currency persist.
2. Feature toggles are role-aware.
3. Settings apply globally where expected.

title: [OPS-001] Observability, security, and production readiness
body:
As SRE/engineering, I want metrics/logs/health/security controls for stable production.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Health and metrics endpoints exist.
2. Alerts for critical workflow failures.
3. Security middleware and validation enforced.

title: [COMM-101] Communications permission and access model
body:
As admin, I want communications read/write permissions so only authorized users can send messages.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. communications.view and communications.write exist.
2. Route and action access are enforced.
3. Sidebar visibility follows permissions.

title: [COMM-102] Communication DTO/model contracts
body:
As developer, I want typed communication contracts so FE and BE remain aligned.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Message/campaign/template/recipient models defined.
2. Validation constraints documented.
3. API envelope standardized.

title: [COMM-103] Communications module scaffold
body:
As user, I want a stable communications module entry route.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. /communications route loads.
2. Shell sections for inbox/campaigns/templates.
3. No runtime errors.

title: [COMM-201] Inbox read path MVP
body:
As tenant/owner/admin, I want inbox with filters and message details.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Pagination and filters work.
2. Unread counts shown.
3. Message detail panel available.

title: [COMM-202] Read/unread state tracking
body:
As user, I want mark read/unread so communication state is accurate.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Open message marks read.
2. Manual read/unread supported.
3. Header unread updates immediately.

title: [COMM-301] Compose and send-now campaign
body:
As sender, I want compose/send-now capability for operational communication.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Compose fields include audience/type/priority.
2. Audience resolution works by role/property.
3. Campaign and recipients are persisted.

title: [COMM-302] Campaign preflight preview
body:
As sender, I want preflight preview to validate audience and message before dispatch.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Audience count preview available.
2. Confirmation required for urgent campaigns.

title: [COMM-401] Schedule and cancel campaigns
body:
As sender, I want schedule/cancel lifecycle so timing is controlled.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Timezone-aware scheduling.
2. Valid status transitions.
3. Cancel before dispatch works.

title: [COMM-402] Retry policy and failed delivery handling
body:
As operator, I want retry and dead-letter handling so delivery reliability improves.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Retry policy configurable.
2. Backoff retries implemented.
3. Dead-letter state captured.

title: [COMM-501] Template management with variables
body:
As admin, I want template CRUD with placeholders so recurring messages are standardized.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Template CRUD and archive work.
2. Placeholder validation exists.
3. Compose can load and preview templates.

title: [COMM-601] Event-driven communication automations
body:
As society admin, I want event-triggered communications to reduce manual follow-up.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Event rule mappings are configurable.
2. Trigger sends are idempotent.
3. Execution logs are visible.

title: [COMM-701] Communication logs and exports
body:
As auditor/admin, I want logs + export for compliance and dispute resolution.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Sender/date/status filters available.
2. CSV/PDF export supported.
3. Recipient-level timestamps included.

title: [COMM-702] Channel preferences and quiet hours
body:
As user, I want communication preferences so messaging is relevant and non-intrusive.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Per-channel preferences saved.
2. Quiet hours enforced for non-critical messages.

title: [COMM-801] Communications observability and health metrics
body:
As SRE, I want delivery metrics and alerts so failures are detected early.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Metrics for sent/failed/retry/latency.
2. Threshold alert support.
3. Health endpoint available.

title: [COMM-802] Communications QA automation and coverage
body:
As QA, I want end-to-end test coverage for critical communication flows.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. Unit/integration tests pass in CI.
2. Key campaign and inbox paths automated.
